title: Pixel 3a - Backup still NOT working with security pin/password enabled
content:
VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH GOOGLE RESPONSE TO FIX THIS BUG!

I purchased a Pixel 3a in 2019 and the BACKUP function is stuck in the "waiting state" until I turn off all security locks (pin, password). Then it works.  I have reported this in 2019 and so have others.  I am VERY disappointed that Google has not yet fixed this BUG in the code.  I just update to Android 10 and checked that I am up-to-date but the bug still remains.  I noticed the bug has been reported as far back as 2018.  Why can't Google fix a bug that would allow backup to GOOGLE Drive?  Great phone but disappointed in the support for fixing a simple bug. 

Do others have the same problem with Pixel 4 XL?   

With Security enabled:
Automatic BACKUP - not working
Manual Backup - button grayed out (not working)

Without Security enabled:
Automatic Backup works
Manual Backup - button Blue and working

Again, Google is always reporting other companies' bug/security gaps but ignores one of its known bugs for 2 years.

Note: Any time the security is enabled the backup will NOT work.

This bug is VERY old and NOT being FIXED see:
https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/1520722?hl=en

Pixel Backup to Google Drive - Backup Now button greyed out shows Waiting to Backup

NO FIX  -  just work arounds --- Why can't Google fix this bug?  Google is still selling phones with this bug and NO fix and people are still buying a bugging phone.
